00039 /**
00040 * @file semaphore.h
00041 * @date 2008/05/10 16:37
00042 * @author Sergio Montenegro
00043 *
00044 * Copyright 2008 DLR
00045 *
00046 * @breif binary semaphore, mutex a synchronisation primitive 
00047 */
00048 
00049 #ifndef __SEMAPHORE_H__
00050 #define __SEMAPHORE_H__
00051 
00052 #include "thread.h"
00053 
00054 
00055 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00056 namespace RODOS {
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 /**
00060 * @class Semaphore
00061 * @brief a synchronisation primitive
00062 *
00063 * Mutex Semaphore.
00064 * the next thread to be activated is
00065 * selected according to priorities and
00066 * not come first serve first.
00067 *
00068 */
00069 
00070 class Semaphore {
00071 
00072 private:
00073   Thread* owner;
00074   long ownerPriority;
00075   void* context; ///< used only on posix and on host-os
00076   int ownerEnterCnt;
00077 
00078 public:
00079   /** Constructor */
00080   Semaphore();
00081   // ~Semaphore() { } // Shall never be called. Semaphores may not disapear
00082 
00083   /** caller will be blocked if semaphore is occupied 
00084    ** The owner may reenter the semaphore without deadlock */
00085   void enter();
00086 
00087   /** caller does not block. resumes one waiting thread (enter) */
00088   void leave();
00089 
00090   /** true if semaphore is free:
00091   *   Warning: next it can be occupied by someone else
00092   */
00093   // bool isFree();
00094  
00095   /// This ist jus a help für the macro PROTECT_WITH_SEMAPHORE
00096   inline bool enterRetTrue() { enter(); return true; }
00097 };
00098 
00099 #define PROTECT_WITH_SEMAPHORE(sem) \
00100   for(bool _onlyonce_ = sem.enterRetTrue(); _onlyonce_ ; _onlyonce_ = false, sem.leave()) 
00101 
00102 
00103 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00104 }
00105 #endif
00106 
00107 #endif /* __SEMAPHORE_H__ */
